page.title: 11SADBERGE VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: There has been a{Church of England school in{Sadberge}since 1799 when one was built in the corner of the church yard,this was replaced in 1867 by another school which is now the village hall the centre of village social life.The present school was built in 1964 for the neighbouring village of {Longnewton and Sadberge, however Longnewton now has a school of its own so there are now only about {fifty children}at Sadberge.There are three classes,an{infant class}aged 4 to 7 years,the{second class}has 7 and 8 year olds and the{third}9,10 and 11 year olds.After this the children go to{Haughton Comprehensive School}in Darlington.The school has a headteacher,two full time and a half time teacher.It also has a cook for the dinners and a caretaker and a cleaner. By Norman Richards.
